replies.body: Kinda sick of seeing this post every 5 minutes, s is literally a perfect game the pinnacle average at what that champ has been played if you don't have 300 Cs complete map dominance and a shit load of objective assists you will not get an s

You couldn't be more wrong. 
And heres the proof:

http://imgur.com/gsr3c5c

Picture 1:
I was a Leona, i had 9 less kills than Vi, 2 more deaths, only 4 more assists, 3.2 K less gold, and 62 less CS. (Vi also helped on pretty much every objective, many more than i did) so we can be fairly confident that she played better than i did. Yet she was ranked not 1 but 2 whole tiers below me, i got an S+ and she got an S-

Picture 2:
I was Taric, i had less kills than anivia, infinite more deaths, but i did have more assists. again i got less CS and less gold. She had a Perfect game (the definition of 'perfect game' being a game where you didn't die once.) and yet i get an S+ (for what, lets be honest is a very average support KDA) and she only gets an S- (for what is quite a good KDA for a squishy mage at 25 mins) 
Also look at Ashe's score... she didn't get an S at all. and her score is way better than bot mine and Anivia's.

It is very clear that some roles are biast in champion mastery, support being one of them. 

So i dare you to try and tell me now that you need a perfect game and 300 CS to get an S (cos i never got either in those games and i got S+ in both.) 

The system doesn't treat roles equally, it is very very hard to get an S with an ADC or assassin, and piss easy to get it with a support.

**The system is based on the champion played in the role they are being played in, comparing the player's end game stats to the average end game stats of the same champion in the same role.**  

* It doesnt go "oh look a support, lets go easy on them with the things needed to get an s". 
* Likewise, it doesnt go "an assassin?!? we should make it near impossible to get a high grade mawahahaha".

Annie top, Annie mid and Annie support could all have the exact same score/gold/objective assists at the end of the game and will still each get different grades. 

The reason it is harder to get an S with an adc or an assassin, is because there are more people playing them and getting really really good scores. Normally these kinds of scores would be anomalous and balanced out by players also having really really bad scores, but it seems the more snowball type of champions (e.g. not supports or tanks) are having more good games than bad games played and pushing the grade boundaries far up.
